trans-unit.source: Represents an extensibility element added to an XML Web service.

In a derived class, the `ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension` class allows users to define extensibility elements in addition to those defined in the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) specification.
Extensibility elements can be added to a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> at any of several levels within the class hierarchy.

Thus many classes derived from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.DocumentableItem> class (including the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> class) have an `Extensions` property, which returns a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtensionCollection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension"></xref> class.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension"></xref> is used by the import process when the extensibility element is imported.

A derived class, representing an extensibility element added to an XML Web service, can be attached to a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> by using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Import%2A> method (which is used by the wsdl.exe tool).
You can also use a custom class derived from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter> class to extend the import process to handle custom extensibility elements.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension"></xref> is used by the import process; otherwise, `false`.

When overridden in a derived class, the class returned by this property will be a derived class within the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description> namespace rather than the base <xref:System.Object> class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension"></xref> is necessary for the action to which it refers.
